answers.answer: It's called Xerosis cutis or just simply dry skin. It can be caused by environmental factors,  vitamin disorders, dehydration, or sometimes diabetes.  Try having her take colder showers and less of them. The heat of them tends to dry the skin out more and obviously the impact of the water is taking away those natural moisturizing oils. Use lots of moisturizing lotions sometimes Cortisol cream helps as well

question: What may cause my daughter to have the skin on her hands become extremely wrinkled (way more than the average wrinkling that normally appears) plus a burning sensation that makes her cry during showering and swimming?
title: Hands wrinkled & burn during showers
